name: Tesco Welsh Beef Top Side Roasting Joint
description: Tesco puts quality first when it comes to its fresh meat and ensures that the
farms supplying our approved abattoirs are farm assured and meet the high
standards of the Tesco Livestock Code of Practice. Our Beef Topside, Top Rump
and Silverside joints are matured to offer a fuller meaty flavour and are made
with extra basting fat for added succulence. These traditional cuts are
excellent for roasting or sliced and eaten cold.
Suggested serving per person of raw meat 125g   140g (as a guide for meal
usage: <Cooking_Instructions><Oven><Temperature F="350°F" G="Gas 4" C="180°C" /></Oven><Microwave><Item23 LineNumber="1" Step="" T650="" T750="" T850="" /></Microwave><Barbeque /><Grill /><Shallow_Fry /><Deep_Fry /><Stir_Fry /><Steam /><Poach /><Hob /><Boil_In_The_Bag /><Other_Instructions>• Remove all packaging.• Allow the meat to sit at room temperature for 10 minutes• Pre-heat the oven to 180oC/350oF/Gas Mark 4. • Then calculate the cooking time per 100g meat as• Rare: 4 minutes for each 100g in weight or part thereof plus 20 minutes extra • Medium: 5 minutes for each 100g in weight or part thereof plus 25 minutes extra • Well done: 6 minutes for each 100g in weight or part thereof plus 30 minutes extra.• Allow the joint to rest in a warm place for 10 minutes before serving to relax.• Remove string prior to serving.• E.g. For a 900g joint cooked rare cooking times will be (4 x 9 = 36) + 20 = 56 mins.• Rare meat will be red in the middle with some blood.• Medium meat will be pink in the middle• Well done meat will be brown right through</Other_Instructions><Oven_From_Frozen><Temperature F="" G="" C="" /></Oven_From_Frozen><Microwave_From_Frozen><Item24 LineNumber="1" Step="" T650="" T750="" T850="" /></Microwave_From_Frozen><Cooking_Precautions>Adjust times according to your particular oven. For fan assisted ovens cooking times should be reduced.All appliances vary these are guidelines only.If cooked rare there is a small risk that harmful bacteria may be present.Tesco recommend that all meat products are cooked thoroughly.Not suitable for microwave cooking.Not suitable for cooking from frozen.</Cooking_Precautions><Preparation_Guidelines>Vacuum packed for freshness.For more information about our strict welfare and quality standards visit www.tesco.com/realfood</Preparation_Guidelines></Cooking_Instructions><Freezing_Instructions><Freezing_Guidelines>Freeze on day of purchase. Use within one month.</Freezing_Guidelines><Defrosting>Defrost thoroughly for a minimum of 24 hours in the refrigerator.IMPORTANT: If food has thawed, do not refreeze.</Defrosting></Freezing_Instructions>
PromotionDescription: 50 extra points on any Tesco Finest meat or fish
